title: Aluminium prices hit highest level of 2025
summary: Aluminium prices have steadily risen throughout 2025, reaching a year-to-date high of USD 2,748.50 per metric tonne on the London Metal Exchange. US aluminium premiums for immediately available metal also hit a record USD 1,738 per tonne, reflecting a 7.2% increase since early October. LME warehouse stocks have fallen below 500,000 tonnes, with nearly half being unsellable sanctioned Russian origin metal.

title: Aluminum price falls to one-month low in wider commodity slump
summary: Aluminum prices dropped as much as 1.6% to $2,526 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, the lowest since November 14, amid a broader commodity slump. The decline follows stronger-than-expected US retail sales data and anticipation of the Federal Reserve's upcoming interest rate decision. Despite short-term weakness, longer-term trends remain bullish due to expected Chinese production slowdowns and emission reduction requirements.

title: Macro and Fundamentals Resonate Positively, Aluminum Prices Expected to Fluctuate at Highs [SMM Aluminum Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: SHFE aluminum futures showed bullish technical indicators on October 23, with prices hovering near recent highs around 21,270 yuan/mt. The market is expected to fluctuate at elevated levels with resistance projected between 21,400-21,580 yuan/mt and support around 20,730-20,930 yuan/mt. Caution is advised for potential pullbacks despite the positive fundamentals.

title: LME Aluminium cash price rises 0.92% on October 23 as inventories decline
summary: The LME aluminium cash price increased by 0.92% to USD 2,843 per tonne on October 23, supported by a decline in inventories by 4,850 tonnes. This price movement reflects tightening supply conditions in the market.

title: Alcoa invests $60M in US aluminium smelter & signs 10-year energy pact at the same time
summary: Alcoa Corporation announced a $60 million investment in its Massena, New York smelter and a new 10-year renewable energy agreement with the New York Power Authority, effective April 2026. The deal secures nearly 240 megawatts of renewable energy and supports sustainable aluminum production in the U.S., with potential for extension.

title: Governor Hochul Announces New Alcoa Power Contract Supporting 500 Jobs & Long-Term Investment in the North Country
summary: New York Governor Kathy Hochul announced a new power supply contract between NYPA and Alcoa, supporting 500 jobs and a $60 million plant modernization through 2028. The agreement, bolstered by state grants and tax credits, ensures Alcoa's continued presence in Massena and regional economic stability.

title: Weekly Recap: Aluminium's low-carbon revolution in action
summary: The global aluminium industry is undergoing a transformation focused on sustainability, innovation, and circular practices. Key developments include Taural India's adoption of Vedanta Aluminium's low-carbon Restora and green sand-casting techniques, reducing casting emissions by up to 80%, and Egypt's 'Dandara' Solar Energy project aiming to cut Egypt Aluminium's greenhouse gas emissions by 30% using renewable energy.

title: AL Circle x Takuo Harato: Advancing sustainability and innovation in the global aluminium industry
summary: Takuo Harato, an Alumina Production Technology Consultant, discusses the aluminium industry's main sustainability challenge of achieving carbon neutrality. He highlights the importance of renewable energy, aluminium recycling, and energy efficiency improvements in refining processes such as heat recovery from calciners to reduce carbon emissions.

title: Can circular aluminium provide a blueprint for a post-plastic world?
summary: Ellie Gabel explores the benefits and challenges of circular aluminium in reducing reliance on plastics. Aluminium's infinite recyclability and existing recycling infrastructure make it a strong candidate for sustainable material use, requiring only 5% of the energy to remanufacture compared to virgin aluminium, thus significantly lowering carbon emissions.

title: UAE Delivers First Batch of Low-Carbon Aluminium Powered by Nuclear Energy from Barakah
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium and Emirates Nuclear Energy Company have produced the UAE's first low-carbon aluminium using clean electricity from the Barakah Nuclear Energy Plant. This product, branded MinimAL, demonstrates nuclear energy's role in decarbonising heavy industries by providing constant, carbon-free power, and has been supplied to Egypt's CANEX Aluminum.

title: BMW Group joins Aluminium Stewardship Initiative
summary: BMW Group has joined the Aluminium Stewardship Initiative to support the development of stringent sustainability standards across the aluminium value chain. The company emphasizes aluminium's role in lightweight construction and its use of recycled or renewable electricity-produced aluminium to reduce CO2 emissions, reinforcing BMW's leadership in sustainable mobility.

title: Steel prices hit five-year low; weak trend likely to persist in near term
summary: Domestic steel prices in India have slumped to a five-year low, trading between Rs 47,000-48,000 per tonne due to rising imports and other factors. The Ministry of Steel has called an open house to discuss import issues, while the RBI noted a surge in steel imports driven by lower prices, urging policy support for domestic producers. Despite falling steel prices, raw material costs like iron ore and coking coal remain relatively stable.

title: Steel rose to 3054 CNY/T on October 24, 2025, up 0.46% from the previous day
summary: Steel prices increased slightly to 3,054 CNY per tonne on October 24, 2025, up 0.46% from the previous day. However, over the past month, steel prices have fallen by 0.75% and are down 5.83% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts expect steel to trade at 3,022.85 Yuan/MT by the end of the quarter and 2,890 Yuan/MT in 12 months.

title: CISA mills' daily crude steel output up 7.5% in early October 2025, stocks also up
summary: The China Iron and Steel Association reported a 7.5% increase in average daily crude steel output by large and medium-sized steel enterprises in China during early October 2025 compared to late September. Finished steel inventories also rose by 8.2% to 15.88 million mt as of October 10, indicating increased production and stockpiling.

title: CISA mills' daily crude steel output up 7.5% in early October 2025
summary: The China Iron and Steel Association (CISA) reported that the average daily crude steel output of large and medium-sized steel enterprises in China increased by 7.5% in early October 2025 compared to late September. Finished steel inventories also rose by 8.2% as of October 10, 2025.

title: worldsteel Short Range Outlook October 2025
summary: The World Steel Association released its latest Short Range Outlook projecting global steel demand to remain flat in 2025 at about 1,749 million tonnes, with a modest rebound of 1.3% expected in 2026. Growth drivers include slowing declines in China, strong demand in developing economies like India and Vietnam, and a recovery in Europe and the US.

title: Global steel demand to stabilise in 2025 before recovery in 2026
source: The Coal Hub (based on World Steel Association data)
summary: Global steel demand is expected to stabilize at 1.75 billion tonnes in 2025 with a 1.3% increase forecast for 2026. The report highlights slowing declines in China’s steel demand and strong growth in India, Vietnam, Egypt, and Saudi Arabia, supporting ongoing steel production and coal use in key regions.

title: CRU: JSW Steel powers to four-fold profit rise
summary: India's JSW Steel reported a 307% year-on-year jump in net profit to INR16.5 billion ($188 million) in fiscal Q2 2025-26. The report also notes global steel production declined through August 2025, with August marking the second-lowest monthly production this year, down 13% from March.

title: Iron, steel imports surge as State Bank relaxes curbs
summary: Iron and steel scrap imports reached 359,759 tonnes in September 2025, marking a 30% year-on-year and 36% month-on-month increase. The surge follows the State Bank's relaxation of import restrictions, impacting the steel supply chain.

title: Reinventing Steel for a Stronger, Lighter, Greener Future
summary: The steel industry is undergoing a transformation with the development of next-generation steel that is stronger, lighter, and more sustainable. This innovation is driven by the need for more sustainable construction materials and is expected to benefit construction professionals and investors alike. Challenges remain, but the momentum towards greener steel is undeniable.

title: Signals of Change – October 2025
summary: Microsoft has signed a seven-year deal for green hydrogen-based steel from Stegra, highlighting the growing trend of technology giants investing in clean industrial materials. This move is part of a broader shift towards decarbonizing industries like steel and cement. The clean industrial revolution is expected to create new jobs and opportunities.

title: STEEL TECH Successfully Closes Its Second Edition
summary: The STEEL TECH event in Bilbao focused on sustainability and innovation in the steel sector, attracting over 790 professionals from more than 25 countries. The event highlighted the importance of positioning the steel industry as a leader in sustainability and technology. It also emphasized the need for collaborative platforms and human capital.

title: SteelDays Celebrates Sustainability
summary: In honor of SteelDays, the focus is on innovations and leaders making steel a sustainable choice. The event highlights cutting-edge mills and sustainable practices in the steel industry. It emphasizes the role of steel in sustainable construction.

title: Why Copper Highs and a Platinum Deficit Matter Now
summary: LME copper prices have remained resilient in October 2025, trading around $10,612 per tonne, close to record highs earlier this year. A steady drawdown in LME warehouse stocks signals physical demand outpacing supply, supported by strong demand from the US and India and structural growth driven by electrification and renewable energy investments.

title: Copper price rises on mine struggles, Goldman bull flag
summary: Copper prices climbed nearly 2% amid supply concerns after a top miner gave a conservative production outlook. Prices surged above $10,800 per tonne on the LME, driven by mine outages in Chile and Indonesia. The metal has rallied over 20% this year due to global mine disruptions and supply setbacks.

title: Copper price hovers near $11,000 as test of record high beckons
summary: Copper traded just below $11,000 a ton, nearing last year's record high, amid supply concerns from mishaps at major mines including Freeport-McMoRan’s Grasberg pit in Indonesia. The metal has rallied about 25% this year, recovering from a sell-off earlier in 2025, with supply challenges dominating investor focus.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Copper futures rose to $5.09 per pound, reaching over one-week highs due to ongoing supply disruptions including mine collapses and halted operations in Indonesia and Chile. Prices have increased 7.74% over the past month and 17.33% year-over-year, supported by supply tightness and geopolitical factors affecting trade.

title: Robert Friedland says global economy faces copper crisis
summary: Industry veteran Robert Friedland warns that global copper demand is accelerating toward levels that could outstrip supply within two decades, requiring mining of as much copper in 18 years as in the past 10,000 years. Copper prices have risen 55% over five years but remain below levels needed to incentivize new production, with $15,000 per tonne predicted as necessary for new mine development.

title: Copper price rises on mine struggles, Goldman bull flag
summary: Copper prices climbed nearly 2% due to conservative production outlooks from major miners, including Chile’s Antofagasta, which expects to hit the low end of its 2025 production target and gave a 2026 forecast below analyst estimates. The supply concerns are exacerbated by global mine outages and production setbacks, notably at Chile’s El Teniente and Indonesia’s Grasberg mines.

title: Global Copper Supply Forecast Reduction Hits 500K Tonnes
summary: Goldman Sachs revised copper supply forecasts downward by 500,000 tonnes in 2025 due to operational disruptions at major mines such as Grasberg, El Teniente, Cobre Panama, and Kamoa-Kakula. Recovery of block cave mining operations is complex and slow, with full production restoration expected only by 2027, and 2026 production projected to be 35% lower than pre-incident estimates.

title: Copper price hovers near $11,000 as test of record high beckons
summary: Copper prices remain near $11,000 per ton, close to last year's record high, driven by supply concerns following incidents at major mines including Freeport-McMoRan’s Grasberg pit, which remains halted after a fatal mudslide. The metal has rallied about 25% this year amid supply challenges and geopolitical trade tensions.

title: Trump reverses Biden-era rules on copper smelters
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump reversed a Biden-era air pollution rule that imposed stricter emissions limits on copper smelters, granting a two-year exemption to reduce regulatory burdens on domestic producers. The move aims to promote American mineral security by preventing closures of the already limited U.S. copper smelting capacity, which currently includes only two smelters.

title: Harmony Gold's $1.01B MAC Copper Acquisition Complete
summary: Harmony Gold completed a $1.01 billion acquisition of MAC Copper, marking a strategic expansion into copper mining within Australia. The acquisition of the CSA copper mine provides immediate production capacity in a stable jurisdiction, positioning Harmony to benefit from tightening global copper supply and the energy transition economy.

title: LME nickel prices rise on Oct 25 due to bullish news
summary: LME nickel futures increased by US$43 on October 25, closing at US$18,317/ton, with the spot price also rising by US$43 to US$18,085/ton, driven by bullish market news.

title: Nickel Market at Inflection Point as Indonesia Signals Q1 2026 Tightness
summary: Nickel prices are testing the upper end of their 3-4 month range with potential upward movement expected as Chinese markets return from holiday. Indonesian supply management plans and government interventions in critical minerals are creating a structural shift, signaling tightness in Q1 2026 and significant revaluations in nickel-related stocks.

title: [SMM Analysis] Nickel prices pulled back this week due to fundamental pressure and inventory levels increased further
summary: Nickel prices declined under fundamental pressure with SHFE nickel futures closing down 1.89% week-on-week and LME nickel prices down 0.53%. The market is characterized by cost support at the bottom and inventory pressure at the top, with improved trading sentiment despite the price pullback.

title: TRADE REVIEW: Global nickel market eyes oversupply in Q4 as shifting trade policy feeds uncertainty
summary: Nickel ore prices softened in Q3 and are expected to remain weak in Q4 due to oversupply concerns. Supply disruptions and export quotas in cobalt and nickel feedstocks are influencing market dynamics, with Chinese imports rising but supply tightness persisting through Q4.

title: Persistent Supply Disruptions Sustain Upward Pressure on LME Nickel Prices
summary: Despite an oversupply pattern, Indonesian policy changes and expectations of US interest rate cuts have supported LME nickel prices, which showed an upward trend in early October. However, high inventory and limited impact from Indonesian policy changes keep Shanghai nickel prices subdued.

title: TRADE REVIEW: Global nickel market eyes oversupply in Q4 as shifting trade policy feeds uncertainty
summary: The global nickel market is facing oversupply in Q4, with Indonesian output continuing to flood the market and LME inventories reaching multi-year highs. Despite temporary tightness in MHP (mixed hydroxide precipitate) supply due to disruptions and cobalt feedstock issues, overall nickel production capacity remains ample, keeping prices under pressure.

title: Nickel futures fall to over 1-month low as oversupply persists
summary: Nickel futures dropped to their lowest level in over a month, pressured by persistent oversupply from Indonesia, where production capacity has surged since the 2020 ore export ban. LME nickel stockpiles have risen sharply this year, reflecting weak demand from stainless steel manufacturers despite growing nickel use in electric vehicles.

title: [SMM Analysis] Nickel prices pulled back this week due to fundamental pressure and inventory levels increased further
summary: Nickel prices declined this week as fundamental pressures and rising inventories weighed on the market. Both SHFE and LME nickel contracts showed synchronized weakness, with spot market premiums fluctuating slightly and trading volumes picking up despite the overall bearish sentiment.

title: Breakthrough Green Technology Set to Revolutionize Nickel Pollution Cleanup
summary: A new green technology using olivine, a magnesium-iron silicate mineral, shows promise in counteracting nickel pollution by neutralizing toxic nickel ions in soils and oceans. This approach helps restore environmental balance and resilience by releasing essential minerals and reducing acidification caused by nickel mining waste.

title: Hunting e-waste: India pushes for recycling of critical minerals
summary: India is expanding its electronic waste recycling capacity to recover critical minerals including nickel, lithium, and cobalt. The government launched a Rs 1,500 crore Incentive Scheme for Critical Mineral Recycling to reduce import dependence and promote sustainable recovery from e-waste and spent lithium-ion batteries.

title: Overview of the North American battery metals supply chain
summary: The US and Canada are collaborating to secure and innovate the battery metals supply chain, including nickel. Efforts focus on joint research, harmonizing regulations, and advancing refining and processing technologies to improve sustainability and domestic production capabilities for battery metals.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali, a leading steel producer in Italy, has started the pilot phase of its green hydrogen project at its Aosta plant. The project uses a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane electrolyzer to produce 165 tons of green hydrogen annually, aiming to reduce carbon emissions by powering one of its 70 furnaces entirely. This initiative is supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: As part of the 'Green Hydrogen in Cogne' initiative, Cogne Acciai Speciali has launched a pilot plant to replace fossil natural gas with green hydrogen in industrial steel production. This project represents a significant step towards decarbonizing the steel industry in Italy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Greenland grants 30-year permit to EU-backed Molybdenum mine
summary: Greenland Resources secured a 30-year permit for its Malmbjerg molybdenum project, which will supply about 25% of the EU’s molybdenum demand. Italy’s Cogne Acciai Speciali is among the industrial partners with off-take agreements, highlighting its strategic interest in securing critical raw materials for steel production.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali approves capital increase
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has approved a capital increase to support its continued inorganic growth, indicating strategic financial moves to strengthen its position in the stainless steel market.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris to showcase its strong presence, advanced product solutions at OMC 2023
summary: Tenaris highlighted its advanced portfolio of solutions at the OMC Med Energy Conference and Exhibition in Ravenna, Italy. The company emphasized its long-standing presence in Europe and the Mediterranean, supporting complex energy projects with high-end products and services, including OCTG and line pipe products for fast-track projects and low carbon energy applications such as carbon capture, geothermal, and hydrogen storage.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion on the future of the Italian boilermaking industry focused on nuclear energy, held at Fondazione Dalmine in Italy. The event gathered industry and institutional experts to discuss nuclear energy's strategic role in Europe's energy transition and Italy's manufacturing potential. Tenaris's Italian mill recently obtained accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities, aligning with the highest technical and quality standards.

title: Axpo Italia to supply green energy to Tenaris' Dalmine seamless steel pipe mill in Italy
summary: Under a Power Purchase Agreement, Axpo Italia will provide 15 GWh of green energy to Tenaris' Dalmine seamless steel pipe mill in Italy, supporting the mill's sustainability and energy efficiency goals.

title: Italy's Tenaris to invest US$200 million in Colombian mill
summary: Tenaris plans to invest US$200 million to build a new heat treatment mill and install advanced technology for ultrasound inspection and finishing. This investment aims to enhance production capabilities and product sophistication, although it concerns a Colombian facility rather than Italy directly.
